interfaces.hardware.serial_devicesÂ¶

Source: src\interfaces\hardware\serial_devices.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

No module docstring available.

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#===================== src/interfaces/hardware/serial_devices.py ======================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Serial communication device interfaces for control systems.
  7This module provides standardized interfaces for serial communication
  8protocols including RS232/485, Modbus RTU/TCP, CAN bus, and other
  9industrial communication standards commonly used in control systems.
 10"""
 11
 12from __future__ import annotations
 13
 14import asyncio
 15import serial
 16from abc import ABC, abstractmethod
 17from dataclasses import dataclass
 18from typing import Dict, Any, Optional, List, Union
 19from enum import Enum
 20
 21from .device_drivers import DeviceDriver, DeviceConfig, DeviceCapability
 22
 23try:
 24    import serial_asyncio
 25    SERIAL_ASYNCIO_AVAILABLE = True
 26except ImportError:
 27    SERIAL_ASYNCIO_AVAILABLE = False
 28
 29try:
 30    from pymodbus.client.sync import ModbusSerialClient, ModbusTcpClient
 31    from pymodbus.payload import BinaryPayloadDecoder, BinaryPayloadBuilder
 32    from pymodbus.constants import Endian
 33    PYMODBUS_AVAILABLE = True
 34except ImportError:
 35    PYMODBUS_AVAILABLE = False
 36
 37try:
 38    import can
 39    CAN_AVAILABLE = True
 40except ImportError:
 41    CAN_AVAILABLE = False
 42
 43
 44class SerialProtocol(Enum):
 45    """Serial communication protocol enumeration."""
 46    RS232 = "rs232"
 47    RS485 = "rs485"
 48    MODBUS_RTU = "modbus_rtu"
 49    MODBUS_TCP = "modbus_tcp"
 50    CAN = "can"
 51    PROFIBUS = "profibus"
 52    DEVICENET = "devicenet"
 53
 54
 55class DataType(Enum):
 56    """Data type enumeration for serial communication."""
 57    UINT16 = "uint16"
 58    INT16 = "int16"
 59    UINT32 = "uint32"
 60    INT32 = "int32"
 61    FLOAT32 = "float32"
 62    BOOL = "bool"
 63    STRING = "string"
 64
 65
 66@dataclass
 67class SerialConfig:
 68    """Serial communication configuration."""
 69    port: str
 70    baudrate: int = 9600
 71    bytesize: int = 8
 72    parity: str = 'N'  # N, E, O
 73    stopbits: int = 1
 74    timeout: float = 1.0
 75    protocol: SerialProtocol = SerialProtocol.RS232
 76
 77
 78@dataclass
 79class ModbusRegister:
 80    """Modbus register configuration."""
 81    name: str
 82    address: int
 83    data_type: DataType
 84    function_code: int  # 1, 2, 3, 4
 85    unit_id: int = 1
 86    count: int = 1
 87    scaling: float = 1.0
 88    offset: float = 0.0
 89    unit: str = ""
 90    read_only: bool = True
 91
 92
 93@dataclass
 94class CANMessage:
 95    """CAN message structure."""
 96    timestamp: float
 97    arbitration_id: int
 98    data: bytes
 99    is_extended: bool = False
100    is_remote: bool = False
101    channel: Optional[str] = None
102
103
104class SerialDevice(DeviceDriver, ABC):
105    """
106    Abstract base class for serial communication devices.
107
108    This class provides common functionality for serial communication
109    including connection management, message framing, and error handling.
110    """
111
112    def __init__(self, config: DeviceConfig):
113        """Initialize serial device."""
114        super().__init__(config)
115        self._serial_config = SerialConfig(**config.connection_params)
116        self._serial_port: Optional[serial.Serial] = None
117        self._reader: Optional[asyncio.StreamReader] = None
118        self._writer: Optional[asyncio.StreamWriter] = None
119        self._receive_task: Optional[asyncio.Task] = None
120        self._message_handlers: List[callable] = []
121
122    @property
123    def is_connected(self) -> bool:
124        """Check if serial device is connected."""
125        return self._serial_port is not None and self._serial_port.is_open
126
127    @abstractmethod
128    async def send_message(self, data: bytes) -> bool:
129        """
130        Send message over serial interface.
131
132        Parameters
133        ----------
134        data : bytes
135            Message data to send
136
137        Returns
138        -------
139        bool
140            True if send successful
141        """
142        pass
143
144    @abstractmethod
145    async def receive_message(self, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[bytes]:
146        """
147        Receive message from serial interface.
148
149        Parameters
150        ----------
151        timeout : float, optional
152            Receive timeout
153
154        Returns
155        -------
156        bytes or None
157            Received message data
158        """
159        pass
160
161    async def connect_serial(self) -> bool:
162        """Connect to serial device."""
163        try:
164            if SERIAL_ASYNCIO_AVAILABLE:
165                # Use asyncio serial for better performance
166                reader, writer = await serial_asyncio.open_serial_connection(
167                    url=self._serial_config.port,
168                    baudrate=self._serial_config.baudrate,
169                    bytesize=self._serial_config.bytesize,
170                    parity=self._serial_config.parity,
171                    stopbits=self._serial_config.stopbits,
172                    timeout=self._serial_config.timeout
173                )
174                self._reader = reader
175                self._writer = writer
176            else:
177                # Fallback to synchronous serial
178                self._serial_port = serial.Serial(
179                    port=self._serial_config.port,
180                    baudrate=self._serial_config.baudrate,
181                    bytesize=self._serial_config.bytesize,
182                    parity=self._serial_config.parity,
183                    stopbits=self._serial_config.stopbits,
184                    timeout=self._serial_config.timeout
185                )
186
187            self._logger.info(f"Connected to serial device on {self._serial_config.port}")
188            return True
189
190        except Exception as e:
191            self._logger.error(f"Failed to connect to serial device: {e}")
192            return False
193
194    async def disconnect_serial(self) -> bool:
195        """Disconnect from serial device."""
196        try:
197            if self._receive_task:
198                self._receive_task.cancel()
199                try:
200                    await self._receive_task
201                except asyncio.CancelledError:
202                    pass
203
204            if self._writer:
205                self._writer.close()
206                await self._writer.wait_closed()
207                self._writer = None
208                self._reader = None
209
210            if self._serial_port and self._serial_port.is_open:
211                self._serial_port.close()
212                self._serial_port = None
213
214            self._logger.info("Disconnected from serial device")
215            return True
216
217        except Exception as e:
218            self._logger.error(f"Error disconnecting from serial device: {e}")
219            return False
220
221    def add_message_handler(self, handler: callable) -> None:
222        """Add message handler for received data."""
223        self._message_handlers.append(handler)
224
225    async def _receive_loop(self) -> None:
226        """Continuous receive loop."""
227        try:
228            while self.is_connected:
229                try:
230                    message = await self.receive_message(timeout=1.0)
231                    if message:
232                        # Call message handlers
233                        for handler in self._message_handlers:
234                            try:
235                                if asyncio.iscoroutinefunction(handler):
236                                    await handler(message)
237                                else:
238                                    handler(message)
239                            except Exception as e:
240                                self._logger.error(f"Error in message handler: {e}")
241
242                except asyncio.TimeoutError:
243                    continue
244                except Exception as e:
245                    self._logger.error(f"Error in receive loop: {e}")
246                    break
247
248        except asyncio.CancelledError:
249            pass
250
251
252class ModbusDevice(SerialDevice):
253    """
254    Modbus RTU/TCP device implementation.
255
256    Provides Modbus communication for reading and writing
257    holding registers, input registers, coils, and discrete inputs.
258    """
259
260    def __init__(self, config: DeviceConfig):
261        """Initialize Modbus device."""
262        if not PYMODBUS_AVAILABLE:
263            raise ImportError("pymodbus not available. Install with: pip install pymodbus")
264
265        super().__init__(config)
266        self._modbus_client: Optional[Union[ModbusSerialClient, ModbusTcpClient]] = None
267        self._registers: Dict[str, ModbusRegister] = {}
268        self._default_unit_id = config.operational_params.get('unit_id', 1)
269        self._tcp_host = config.connection_params.get('tcp_host', 'localhost')
270        self._tcp_port = config.connection_params.get('tcp_port', 502)
271
272    async def initialize(self) -> bool:
273        """Initialize Modbus device."""
274        self._logger.info(f"Initializing Modbus device {self.device_id}")
275
276        try:
277            if self._serial_config.protocol == SerialProtocol.MODBUS_RTU:
278                self._modbus_client = ModbusSerialClient(
279                    method='rtu',
280                    port=self._serial_config.port,
281                    baudrate=self._serial_config.baudrate,
282                    bytesize=self._serial_config.bytesize,
283                    parity=self._serial_config.parity,
284                    stopbits=self._serial_config.stopbits,
285                    timeout=self._serial_config.timeout
286                )
287            elif self._serial_config.protocol == SerialProtocol.MODBUS_TCP:
288                self._modbus_client = ModbusTcpClient(
289                    host=self._tcp_host,
290                    port=self._tcp_port,
291                    timeout=self._serial_config.timeout
292                )
293            else:
294                raise ValueError(f"Unsupported protocol: {self._serial_config.protocol}")
295
296            # Connect to Modbus device
297            if self._modbus_client.connect():
298                self._logger.info("Connected to Modbus device")
299                return True
300            else:
301                self._logger.error("Failed to connect to Modbus device")
302                return False
303
304        except Exception as e:
305            self._logger.error(f"Failed to initialize Modbus device: {e}")
306            return False
307
308    async def shutdown(self) -> bool:
309        """Shutdown Modbus device."""
310        try:
311            if self._modbus_client:
312                self._modbus_client.close()
313                self._modbus_client = None
314            return True
315        except Exception as e:
316            self._logger.error(f"Error shutting down Modbus device: {e}")
317            return False
318
319    async def read_data(self, channel: Optional[str] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
320        """Read data from Modbus device."""
321        if channel:
322            if channel in self._registers:
323                value = await self.read_register(channel)
324                return {channel: value}
325            return {}
326        else:
327            # Read all registers
328            data = {}
329            for reg_name in self._registers:
330                try:
331                    value = await self.read_register(reg_name)
332                    data[reg_name] = value
333                except Exception as e:
334                    self._logger.warning(f"Failed to read register {reg_name}: {e}")
335            return data
336
337    async def write_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
338        """Write data to Modbus device."""
339        try:
340            for reg_name, value in data.items():
341                if reg_name in self._registers:
342                    await self.write_register(reg_name, value)
343            return True
344        except Exception as e:
345            self._logger.error(f"Failed to write Modbus data: {e}")
346            return False
347
348    async def self_test(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
349        """Perform Modbus device self-test."""
350        test_results = await super().self_test()
351
352        try:
353            # Test connection
354            if self._modbus_client and self._modbus_client.socket:
355                test_results['connection_active'] = True
356
357                # Test read capability
358                if self._registers:
359                    test_reg = list(self._registers.keys())[0]
360                    value = await self.read_register(test_reg)
361                    test_results['read_functional'] = value is not None
362                else:
363                    test_results['read_functional'] = True
364
365            else:
366                test_results['connection_active'] = False
367                test_results['overall_status'] = 'FAIL'
368
369        except Exception as e:
370            test_results['modbus_error'] = str(e)
371            test_results['overall_status'] = 'FAIL'
372
373        return test_results
374
375    async def send_message(self, data: bytes) -> bool:
376        """Send raw Modbus message."""
377        # For Modbus, typically use higher-level read/write methods
378        self._logger.warning("Use read_register/write_register for Modbus communication")
379        return False
380
381    async def receive_message(self, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[bytes]:
382        """Receive raw Modbus message."""
383        # For Modbus, typically use higher-level read/write methods
384        return None
385
386    async def add_register(self, register: ModbusRegister) -> bool:
387        """Add Modbus register configuration."""
388        try:
389            self._registers[register.name] = register
390
391            # Add capability
392            capability = DeviceCapability(
393                name=register.name,
394                description=f"Modbus register at address {register.address}",
395                data_type=register.data_type.value,
396                unit=register.unit,
397                read_only=register.read_only
398            )
399            self.add_capability(capability)
400
401            self._logger.info(f"Added Modbus register {register.name}")
402            return True
403
404        except Exception as e:
405            self._logger.error(f"Failed to add register {register.name}: {e}")
406            return False
407
408    async def read_register(self, register_name: str) -> Optional[Union[float, int, bool]]:
409        """Read value from Modbus register."""
410        try:
411            if register_name not in self._registers:
412                raise ValueError(f"Register {register_name} not configured")
413
414            register = self._registers[register_name]
415
416            # Read based on function code
417            if register.function_code == 1:  # Read Coils
418                result = self._modbus_client.read_coils(
419                    register.address, register.count, unit=register.unit_id
420                )
421                if result.isError():
422                    raise Exception(f"Modbus error: {result}")
423                return result.bits[0] if register.count == 1 else result.bits
424
425            elif register.function_code == 2:  # Read Discrete Inputs
426                result = self._modbus_client.read_discrete_inputs(
427                    register.address, register.count, unit=register.unit_id
428                )
429                if result.isError():
430                    raise Exception(f"Modbus error: {result}")
431                return result.bits[0] if register.count == 1 else result.bits
432
433            elif register.function_code == 3:  # Read Holding Registers
434                result = self._modbus_client.read_holding_registers(
435                    register.address, register.count, unit=register.unit_id
436                )
437                if result.isError():
438                    raise Exception(f"Modbus error: {result}")
439
440                # Decode based on data type
441                decoder = BinaryPayloadDecoder.fromRegisters(
442                    result.registers, byteorder=Endian.Big
443                )
444                return self._decode_value(decoder, register.data_type, register.scaling, register.offset)
445
446            elif register.function_code == 4:  # Read Input Registers
447                result = self._modbus_client.read_input_registers(
448                    register.address, register.count, unit=register.unit_id
449                )
450                if result.isError():
451                    raise Exception(f"Modbus error: {result}")
452
453                decoder = BinaryPayloadDecoder.fromRegisters(
454                    result.registers, byteorder=Endian.Big
455                )
456                return self._decode_value(decoder, register.data_type, register.scaling, register.offset)
457
458            else:
459                raise ValueError(f"Unsupported function code: {register.function_code}")
460
461        except Exception as e:
462            self._logger.error(f"Failed to read register {register_name}: {e}")
463            return None
464
465    async def write_register(self, register_name: str, value: Union[float, int, bool]) -> bool:
466        """Write value to Modbus register."""
467        try:
468            if register_name not in self._registers:
469                raise ValueError(f"Register {register_name} not configured")
470
471            register = self._registers[register_name]
472
473            if register.read_only:
474                raise ValueError(f"Register {register_name} is read-only")
475
476            # Apply inverse scaling
477            scaled_value = (value - register.offset) / register.scaling
478
479            # Write based on function code
480            if register.function_code == 1:  # Write Coil
481                result = self._modbus_client.write_coil(
482                    register.address, bool(value), unit=register.unit_id
483                )
484                return not result.isError()
485
486            elif register.function_code == 3:  # Write Holding Register
487                # Encode based on data type
488                builder = BinaryPayloadBuilder(byteorder=Endian.Big)
489                self._encode_value(builder, register.data_type, scaled_value)
490
491                result = self._modbus_client.write_registers(
492                    register.address, builder.to_registers(), unit=register.unit_id
493                )
494                return not result.isError()
495
496            else:
497                raise ValueError(f"Cannot write to function code {register.function_code}")
498
499        except Exception as e:
500            self._logger.error(f"Failed to write register {register_name}: {e}")
501            return False
502
503    def _decode_value(self, decoder: BinaryPayloadDecoder, data_type: DataType, scaling: float, offset: float) -> Union[float, int, bool]:
504        """Decode value from Modbus registers."""
505        if data_type == DataType.UINT16:
506            raw_value = decoder.decode_16bit_uint()
507        elif data_type == DataType.INT16:
508            raw_value = decoder.decode_16bit_int()
509        elif data_type == DataType.UINT32:
510            raw_value = decoder.decode_32bit_uint()
511        elif data_type == DataType.INT32:
512            raw_value = decoder.decode_32bit_int()
513        elif data_type == DataType.FLOAT32:
514            raw_value = decoder.decode_32bit_float()
515        elif data_type == DataType.BOOL:
516            raw_value = bool(decoder.decode_16bit_uint())
517        else:
518            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported data type: {data_type}")
519
520        return raw_value * scaling + offset
521
522    def _encode_value(self, builder: BinaryPayloadBuilder, data_type: DataType, value: Union[float, int, bool]) -> None:
523        """Encode value to Modbus registers."""
524        if data_type == DataType.UINT16:
525            builder.add_16bit_uint(int(value))
526        elif data_type == DataType.INT16:
527            builder.add_16bit_int(int(value))
528        elif data_type == DataType.UINT32:
529            builder.add_32bit_uint(int(value))
530        elif data_type == DataType.INT32:
531            builder.add_32bit_int(int(value))
532        elif data_type == DataType.FLOAT32:
533            builder.add_32bit_float(float(value))
534        elif data_type == DataType.BOOL:
535            builder.add_16bit_uint(1 if value else 0)
536        else:
537            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported data type: {data_type}")
538
539
540class CANDevice(SerialDevice):
541    """
542    CAN bus device implementation.
543
544    Provides CAN bus communication for sending and receiving
545    CAN messages with configurable filters and arbitration IDs.
546    """
547
548    def __init__(self, config: DeviceConfig):
549        """Initialize CAN device."""
550        if not CAN_AVAILABLE:
551            raise ImportError("python-can not available. Install with: pip install python-can")
552
553        super().__init__(config)
554        self._can_bus: Optional[can.BusABC] = None
555        self._interface = config.connection_params.get('interface', 'socketcan')
556        self._channel = config.connection_params.get('channel', 'can0')
557        self._bitrate = config.connection_params.get('bitrate', 500000)
558        self._message_filters: List[Dict[str, Any]] = []
559        self._notifier: Optional[can.Notifier] = None
560
561    async def initialize(self) -> bool:
562        """Initialize CAN device."""
563        self._logger.info(f"Initializing CAN device {self.device_id}")
564
565        try:
566            # Create CAN bus
567            self._can_bus = can.interface.Bus(
568                channel=self._channel,
569                interface=self._interface,
570                bitrate=self._bitrate
571            )
572
573            # Set up message notifier
574            self._notifier = can.Notifier(self._can_bus, [self._can_message_handler])
575
576            self._logger.info(f"CAN device initialized on {self._channel}")
577            return True
578
579        except Exception as e:
580            self._logger.error(f"Failed to initialize CAN device: {e}")
581            return False
582
583    async def shutdown(self) -> bool:
584        """Shutdown CAN device."""
585        try:
586            if self._notifier:
587                self._notifier.stop()
588                self._notifier = None
589
590            if self._can_bus:
591                self._can_bus.shutdown()
592                self._can_bus = None
593
594            return True
595
596        except Exception as e:
597            self._logger.error(f"Error shutting down CAN device: {e}")
598            return False
599
600    async def read_data(self, channel: Optional[str] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
601        """Read data from CAN device."""
602        # CAN is message-based, use message handlers instead
603        return {"status": "use_message_handlers"}
604
605    async def write_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
606        """Write data to CAN device."""
607        try:
608            if "message" in data:
609                message_data = data["message"]
610                arbitration_id = message_data.get("id", 0x123)
611                payload = message_data.get("data", b"")
612                is_extended = message_data.get("extended", False)
613
614                return await self.send_can_message(arbitration_id, payload, is_extended)
615
616            return True
617
618        except Exception as e:
619            self._logger.error(f"Failed to write CAN data: {e}")
620            return False
621
622    async def self_test(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
623        """Perform CAN device self-test."""
624        test_results = await super().self_test()
625
626        try:
627            # Test CAN bus connectivity
628            if self._can_bus:
629                test_results['can_bus_active'] = True
630
631                # Send test message
632                test_message = can.Message(
633                    arbitration_id=0x123,
634                    data=[0x01, 0x02, 0x03, 0x04],
635                    is_extended_id=False
636                )
637
638                try:
639                    self._can_bus.send(test_message)
640                    test_results['can_send_functional'] = True
641                except Exception:
642                    test_results['can_send_functional'] = False
643
644            else:
645                test_results['can_bus_active'] = False
646                test_results['overall_status'] = 'FAIL'
647
648        except Exception as e:
649            test_results['can_error'] = str(e)
650            test_results['overall_status'] = 'FAIL'
651
652        return test_results
653
654    async def send_message(self, data: bytes) -> bool:
655        """Send raw CAN message."""
656        # Use send_can_message for proper CAN communication
657        return await self.send_can_message(0x123, data)
658
659    async def receive_message(self, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[bytes]:
660        """Receive raw CAN message."""
661        try:
662            if self._can_bus:
663                message = self._can_bus.recv(timeout=timeout)
664                if message:
665                    return message.data
666            return None
667        except Exception as e:
668            self._logger.error(f"Error receiving CAN message: {e}")
669            return None
670
671    async def send_can_message(self, arbitration_id: int, data: bytes, is_extended: bool = False) -> bool:
672        """Send CAN message with specific arbitration ID."""
673        try:
674            if not self._can_bus:
675                raise Exception("CAN bus not initialized")
676
677            message = can.Message(
678                arbitration_id=arbitration_id,
679                data=data,
680                is_extended_id=is_extended
681            )
682
683            self._can_bus.send(message)
684            self._logger.debug(f"Sent CAN message ID=0x{arbitration_id:X}, data={data.hex()}")
685            return True
686
687        except Exception as e:
688            self._logger.error(f"Failed to send CAN message: {e}")
689            return False
690
691    def add_message_filter(self, arbitration_id: int, mask: int = 0x7FF) -> None:
692        """Add CAN message filter."""
693        self._message_filters.append({
694            'can_id': arbitration_id,
695            'can_mask': mask
696        })
697
698    def _can_message_handler(self, message: can.Message) -> None:
699        """Handle received CAN messages."""
700        try:
701            can_message = CANMessage(
702                timestamp=message.timestamp,
703                arbitration_id=message.arbitration_id,
704                data=message.data,
705                is_extended=message.is_extended_id,
706                is_remote=message.is_remote_frame,
707                channel=self._channel
708            )
709
710            # Call registered message handlers
711            for handler in self._message_handlers:
712                try:
713                    if asyncio.iscoroutinefunction(handler):
714                        asyncio.create_task(handler(can_message))
715                    else:
716                        handler(can_message)
717                except Exception as e:
718                    self._logger.error(f"Error in CAN message handler: {e}")
719
720        except Exception as e:
721            self._logger.error(f"Error processing CAN message: {e}")

SerialDeviceÂ¶

Inherits from: DeviceDriver, ABC

Abstract base class for serial communication devices.

This class provides common functionality for serial communication including connection management, message framing, and error handling.

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class SerialDevice(DeviceDriver, ABC):
  2    """
  3    Abstract base class for serial communication devices.
  4
  5    This class provides common functionality for serial communication
  6    including connection management, message framing, and error handling.
  7    """
  8
  9    def __init__(self, config: DeviceConfig):
 10        """Initialize serial device."""
 11        super().__init__(config)
 12        self._serial_config = SerialConfig(**config.connection_params)
 13        self._serial_port: Optional[serial.Serial] = None
 14        self._reader: Optional[asyncio.StreamReader] = None
 15        self._writer: Optional[asyncio.StreamWriter] = None
 16        self._receive_task: Optional[asyncio.Task] = None
 17        self._message_handlers: List[callable] = []
 18
 19    @property
 20    def is_connected(self) -> bool:
 21        """Check if serial device is connected."""
 22        return self._serial_port is not None and self._serial_port.is_open
 23
 24    @abstractmethod
 25    async def send_message(self, data: bytes) -> bool:
 26        """
 27        Send message over serial interface.
 28
 29        Parameters
 30        ----------
 31        data : bytes
 32            Message data to send
 33
 34        Returns
 35        -------
 36        bool
 37            True if send successful
 38        """
 39        pass
 40
 41    @abstractmethod
 42    async def receive_message(self, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[bytes]:
 43        """
 44        Receive message from serial interface.
 45
 46        Parameters
 47        ----------
 48        timeout : float, optional
 49            Receive timeout
 50
 51        Returns
 52        -------
 53        bytes or None
 54            Received message data
 55        """
 56        pass
 57
 58    async def connect_serial(self) -> bool:
 59        """Connect to serial device."""
 60        try:
 61            if SERIAL_ASYNCIO_AVAILABLE:
 62                # Use asyncio serial for better performance
 63                reader, writer = await serial_asyncio.open_serial_connection(
 64                    url=self._serial_config.port,
 65                    baudrate=self._serial_config.baudrate,
 66                    bytesize=self._serial_config.bytesize,
 67                    parity=self._serial_config.parity,
 68                    stopbits=self._serial_config.stopbits,
 69                    timeout=self._serial_config.timeout
 70                )
 71                self._reader = reader
 72                self._writer = writer
 73            else:
 74                # Fallback to synchronous serial
 75                self._serial_port = serial.Serial(
 76                    port=self._serial_config.port,
 77                    baudrate=self._serial_config.baudrate,
 78                    bytesize=self._serial_config.bytesize,
 79                    parity=self._serial_config.parity,
 80                    stopbits=self._serial_config.stopbits,
 81                    timeout=self._serial_config.timeout
 82                )
 83
 84            self._logger.info(f"Connected to serial device on {self._serial_config.port}")
 85            return True
 86
 87        except Exception as e:
 88            self._logger.error(f"Failed to connect to serial device: {e}")
 89            return False
 90
 91    async def disconnect_serial(self) -> bool:
 92        """Disconnect from serial device."""
 93        try:
 94            if self._receive_task:
 95                self._receive_task.cancel()
 96                try:
 97                    await self._receive_task
 98                except asyncio.CancelledError:
 99                    pass
100
101            if self._writer:
102                self._writer.close()
103                await self._writer.wait_closed()
104                self._writer = None
105                self._reader = None
106
107            if self._serial_port and self._serial_port.is_open:
108                self._serial_port.close()
109                self._serial_port = None
110
111            self._logger.info("Disconnected from serial device")
112            return True
113
114        except Exception as e:
115            self._logger.error(f"Error disconnecting from serial device: {e}")
116            return False
117
118    def add_message_handler(self, handler: callable) -> None:
119        """Add message handler for received data."""
120        self._message_handlers.append(handler)
121
122    async def _receive_loop(self) -> None:
123        """Continuous receive loop."""
124        try:
125            while self.is_connected:
126                try:
127                    message = await self.receive_message(timeout=1.0)
128                    if message:
129                        # Call message handlers
130                        for handler in self._message_handlers:
131                            try:
132                                if asyncio.iscoroutinefunction(handler):
133                                    await handler(message)
134                                else:
135                                    handler(message)
136                            except Exception as e:
137                                self._logger.error(f"Error in message handler: {e}")
138
139                except asyncio.TimeoutError:
140                    continue
141                except Exception as e:
142                    self._logger.error(f"Error in receive loop: {e}")
143                    break
144
145        except asyncio.CancelledError:
146            pass

ModbusDeviceÂ¶

Inherits from: SerialDevice

Modbus RTU/TCP device implementation.

Provides Modbus communication for reading and writing holding registers, input registers, coils, and discrete inputs.

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class ModbusDevice(SerialDevice):
  2    """
  3    Modbus RTU/TCP device implementation.
  4
  5    Provides Modbus communication for reading and writing
  6    holding registers, input registers, coils, and discrete inputs.
  7    """
  8
  9    def __init__(self, config: DeviceConfig):
 10        """Initialize Modbus device."""
 11        if not PYMODBUS_AVAILABLE:
 12            raise ImportError("pymodbus not available. Install with: pip install pymodbus")
 13
 14        super().__init__(config)
 15        self._modbus_client: Optional[Union[ModbusSerialClient, ModbusTcpClient]] = None
 16        self._registers: Dict[str, ModbusRegister] = {}
 17        self._default_unit_id = config.operational_params.get('unit_id', 1)
 18        self._tcp_host = config.connection_params.get('tcp_host', 'localhost')
 19        self._tcp_port = config.connection_params.get('tcp_port', 502)
 20
 21    async def initialize(self) -> bool:
 22        """Initialize Modbus device."""
 23        self._logger.info(f"Initializing Modbus device {self.device_id}")
 24
 25        try:
 26            if self._serial_config.protocol == SerialProtocol.MODBUS_RTU:
 27                self._modbus_client = ModbusSerialClient(
 28                    method='rtu',
 29                    port=self._serial_config.port,
 30                    baudrate=self._serial_config.baudrate,
 31                    bytesize=self._serial_config.bytesize,
 32                    parity=self._serial_config.parity,
 33                    stopbits=self._serial_config.stopbits,
 34                    timeout=self._serial_config.timeout
 35                )
 36            elif self._serial_config.protocol == SerialProtocol.MODBUS_TCP:
 37                self._modbus_client = ModbusTcpClient(
 38                    host=self._tcp_host,
 39                    port=self._tcp_port,
 40                    timeout=self._serial_config.timeout
 41                )
 42            else:
 43                raise ValueError(f"Unsupported protocol: {self._serial_config.protocol}")
 44
 45            # Connect to Modbus device
 46            if self._modbus_client.connect():
 47                self._logger.info("Connected to Modbus device")
 48                return True
 49            else:
 50                self._logger.error("Failed to connect to Modbus device")
 51                return False
 52
 53        except Exception as e:
 54            self._logger.error(f"Failed to initialize Modbus device: {e}")
 55            return False
 56
 57    async def shutdown(self) -> bool:
 58        """Shutdown Modbus device."""
 59        try:
 60            if self._modbus_client:
 61                self._modbus_client.close()
 62                self._modbus_client = None
 63            return True
 64        except Exception as e:
 65            self._logger.error(f"Error shutting down Modbus device: {e}")
 66            return False
 67
 68    async def read_data(self, channel: Optional[str] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 69        """Read data from Modbus device."""
 70        if channel:
 71            if channel in self._registers:
 72                value = await self.read_register(channel)
 73                return {channel: value}
 74            return {}
 75        else:
 76            # Read all registers
 77            data = {}
 78            for reg_name in self._registers:
 79                try:
 80                    value = await self.read_register(reg_name)
 81                    data[reg_name] = value
 82                except Exception as e:
 83                    self._logger.warning(f"Failed to read register {reg_name}: {e}")
 84            return data
 85
 86    async def write_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
 87        """Write data to Modbus device."""
 88        try:
 89            for reg_name, value in data.items():
 90                if reg_name in self._registers:
 91                    await self.write_register(reg_name, value)
 92            return True
 93        except Exception as e:
 94            self._logger.error(f"Failed to write Modbus data: {e}")
 95            return False
 96
 97    async def self_test(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 98        """Perform Modbus device self-test."""
 99        test_results = await super().self_test()
100
101        try:
102            # Test connection
103            if self._modbus_client and self._modbus_client.socket:
104                test_results['connection_active'] = True
105
106                # Test read capability
107                if self._registers:
108                    test_reg = list(self._registers.keys())[0]
109                    value = await self.read_register(test_reg)
110                    test_results['read_functional'] = value is not None
111                else:
112                    test_results['read_functional'] = True
113
114            else:
115                test_results['connection_active'] = False
116                test_results['overall_status'] = 'FAIL'
117
118        except Exception as e:
119            test_results['modbus_error'] = str(e)
120            test_results['overall_status'] = 'FAIL'
121
122        return test_results
123
124    async def send_message(self, data: bytes) -> bool:
125        """Send raw Modbus message."""
126        # For Modbus, typically use higher-level read/write methods
127        self._logger.warning("Use read_register/write_register for Modbus communication")
128        return False
129
130    async def receive_message(self, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[bytes]:
131        """Receive raw Modbus message."""
132        # For Modbus, typically use higher-level read/write methods
133        return None
134
135    async def add_register(self, register: ModbusRegister) -> bool:
136        """Add Modbus register configuration."""
137        try:
138            self._registers[register.name] = register
139
140            # Add capability
141            capability = DeviceCapability(
142                name=register.name,
143                description=f"Modbus register at address {register.address}",
144                data_type=register.data_type.value,
145                unit=register.unit,
146                read_only=register.read_only
147            )
148            self.add_capability(capability)
149
150            self._logger.info(f"Added Modbus register {register.name}")
151            return True
152
153        except Exception as e:
154            self._logger.error(f"Failed to add register {register.name}: {e}")
155            return False
156
157    async def read_register(self, register_name: str) -> Optional[Union[float, int, bool]]:
158        """Read value from Modbus register."""
159        try:
160            if register_name not in self._registers:
161                raise ValueError(f"Register {register_name} not configured")
162
163            register = self._registers[register_name]
164
165            # Read based on function code
166            if register.function_code == 1:  # Read Coils
167                result = self._modbus_client.read_coils(
168                    register.address, register.count, unit=register.unit_id
169                )
170                if result.isError():
171                    raise Exception(f"Modbus error: {result}")
172                return result.bits[0] if register.count == 1 else result.bits
173
174            elif register.function_code == 2:  # Read Discrete Inputs
175                result = self._modbus_client.read_discrete_inputs(
176                    register.address, register.count, unit=register.unit_id
177                )
178                if result.isError():
179                    raise Exception(f"Modbus error: {result}")
180                return result.bits[0] if register.count == 1 else result.bits
181
182            elif register.function_code == 3:  # Read Holding Registers
183                result = self._modbus_client.read_holding_registers(
184                    register.address, register.count, unit=register.unit_id
185                )
186                if result.isError():
187                    raise Exception(f"Modbus error: {result}")
188
189                # Decode based on data type
190                decoder = BinaryPayloadDecoder.fromRegisters(
191                    result.registers, byteorder=Endian.Big
192                )
193                return self._decode_value(decoder, register.data_type, register.scaling, register.offset)
194
195            elif register.function_code == 4:  # Read Input Registers
196                result = self._modbus_client.read_input_registers(
197                    register.address, register.count, unit=register.unit_id
198                )
199                if result.isError():
200                    raise Exception(f"Modbus error: {result}")
201
202                decoder = BinaryPayloadDecoder.fromRegisters(
203                    result.registers, byteorder=Endian.Big
204                )
205                return self._decode_value(decoder, register.data_type, register.scaling, register.offset)
206
207            else:
208                raise ValueError(f"Unsupported function code: {register.function_code}")
209
210        except Exception as e:
211            self._logger.error(f"Failed to read register {register_name}: {e}")
212            return None
213
214    async def write_register(self, register_name: str, value: Union[float, int, bool]) -> bool:
215        """Write value to Modbus register."""
216        try:
217            if register_name not in self._registers:
218                raise ValueError(f"Register {register_name} not configured")
219
220            register = self._registers[register_name]
221
222            if register.read_only:
223                raise ValueError(f"Register {register_name} is read-only")
224
225            # Apply inverse scaling
226            scaled_value = (value - register.offset) / register.scaling
227
228            # Write based on function code
229            if register.function_code == 1:  # Write Coil
230                result = self._modbus_client.write_coil(
231                    register.address, bool(value), unit=register.unit_id
232                )
233                return not result.isError()
234
235            elif register.function_code == 3:  # Write Holding Register
236                # Encode based on data type
237                builder = BinaryPayloadBuilder(byteorder=Endian.Big)
238                self._encode_value(builder, register.data_type, scaled_value)
239
240                result = self._modbus_client.write_registers(
241                    register.address, builder.to_registers(), unit=register.unit_id
242                )
243                return not result.isError()
244
245            else:
246                raise ValueError(f"Cannot write to function code {register.function_code}")
247
248        except Exception as e:
249            self._logger.error(f"Failed to write register {register_name}: {e}")
250            return False
251
252    def _decode_value(self, decoder: BinaryPayloadDecoder, data_type: DataType, scaling: float, offset: float) -> Union[float, int, bool]:
253        """Decode value from Modbus registers."""
254        if data_type == DataType.UINT16:
255            raw_value = decoder.decode_16bit_uint()
256        elif data_type == DataType.INT16:
257            raw_value = decoder.decode_16bit_int()
258        elif data_type == DataType.UINT32:
259            raw_value = decoder.decode_32bit_uint()
260        elif data_type == DataType.INT32:
261            raw_value = decoder.decode_32bit_int()
262        elif data_type == DataType.FLOAT32:
263            raw_value = decoder.decode_32bit_float()
264        elif data_type == DataType.BOOL:
265            raw_value = bool(decoder.decode_16bit_uint())
266        else:
267            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported data type: {data_type}")
268
269        return raw_value * scaling + offset
270
271    def _encode_value(self, builder: BinaryPayloadBuilder, data_type: DataType, value: Union[float, int, bool]) -> None:
272        """Encode value to Modbus registers."""
273        if data_type == DataType.UINT16:
274            builder.add_16bit_uint(int(value))
275        elif data_type == DataType.INT16:
276            builder.add_16bit_int(int(value))
277        elif data_type == DataType.UINT32:
278            builder.add_32bit_uint(int(value))
279        elif data_type == DataType.INT32:
280            builder.add_32bit_int(int(value))
281        elif data_type == DataType.FLOAT32:
282            builder.add_32bit_float(float(value))
283        elif data_type == DataType.BOOL:
284            builder.add_16bit_uint(1 if value else 0)
285        else:
286            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported data type: {data_type}")

CANDeviceÂ¶

Inherits from: SerialDevice

CAN bus device implementation.

Provides CAN bus communication for sending and receiving CAN messages with configurable filters and arbitration IDs.

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class CANDevice(SerialDevice):
  2    """
  3    CAN bus device implementation.
  4
  5    Provides CAN bus communication for sending and receiving
  6    CAN messages with configurable filters and arbitration IDs.
  7    """
  8
  9    def __init__(self, config: DeviceConfig):
 10        """Initialize CAN device."""
 11        if not CAN_AVAILABLE:
 12            raise ImportError("python-can not available. Install with: pip install python-can")
 13
 14        super().__init__(config)
 15        self._can_bus: Optional[can.BusABC] = None
 16        self._interface = config.connection_params.get('interface', 'socketcan')
 17        self._channel = config.connection_params.get('channel', 'can0')
 18        self._bitrate = config.connection_params.get('bitrate', 500000)
 19        self._message_filters: List[Dict[str, Any]] = []
 20        self._notifier: Optional[can.Notifier] = None
 21
 22    async def initialize(self) -> bool:
 23        """Initialize CAN device."""
 24        self._logger.info(f"Initializing CAN device {self.device_id}")
 25
 26        try:
 27            # Create CAN bus
 28            self._can_bus = can.interface.Bus(
 29                channel=self._channel,
 30                interface=self._interface,
 31                bitrate=self._bitrate
 32            )
 33
 34            # Set up message notifier
 35            self._notifier = can.Notifier(self._can_bus, [self._can_message_handler])
 36
 37            self._logger.info(f"CAN device initialized on {self._channel}")
 38            return True
 39
 40        except Exception as e:
 41            self._logger.error(f"Failed to initialize CAN device: {e}")
 42            return False
 43
 44    async def shutdown(self) -> bool:
 45        """Shutdown CAN device."""
 46        try:
 47            if self._notifier:
 48                self._notifier.stop()
 49                self._notifier = None
 50
 51            if self._can_bus:
 52                self._can_bus.shutdown()
 53                self._can_bus = None
 54
 55            return True
 56
 57        except Exception as e:
 58            self._logger.error(f"Error shutting down CAN device: {e}")
 59            return False
 60
 61    async def read_data(self, channel: Optional[str] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 62        """Read data from CAN device."""
 63        # CAN is message-based, use message handlers instead
 64        return {"status": "use_message_handlers"}
 65
 66    async def write_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
 67        """Write data to CAN device."""
 68        try:
 69            if "message" in data:
 70                message_data = data["message"]
 71                arbitration_id = message_data.get("id", 0x123)
 72                payload = message_data.get("data", b"")
 73                is_extended = message_data.get("extended", False)
 74
 75                return await self.send_can_message(arbitration_id, payload, is_extended)
 76
 77            return True
 78
 79        except Exception as e:
 80            self._logger.error(f"Failed to write CAN data: {e}")
 81            return False
 82
 83    async def self_test(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 84        """Perform CAN device self-test."""
 85        test_results = await super().self_test()
 86
 87        try:
 88            # Test CAN bus connectivity
 89            if self._can_bus:
 90                test_results['can_bus_active'] = True
 91
 92                # Send test message
 93                test_message = can.Message(
 94                    arbitration_id=0x123,
 95                    data=[0x01, 0x02, 0x03, 0x04],
 96                    is_extended_id=False
 97                )
 98
 99                try:
100                    self._can_bus.send(test_message)
101                    test_results['can_send_functional'] = True
102                except Exception:
103                    test_results['can_send_functional'] = False
104
105            else:
106                test_results['can_bus_active'] = False
107                test_results['overall_status'] = 'FAIL'
108
109        except Exception as e:
110            test_results['can_error'] = str(e)
111            test_results['overall_status'] = 'FAIL'
112
113        return test_results
114
115    async def send_message(self, data: bytes) -> bool:
116        """Send raw CAN message."""
117        # Use send_can_message for proper CAN communication
118        return await self.send_can_message(0x123, data)
119
120    async def receive_message(self, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[bytes]:
121        """Receive raw CAN message."""
122        try:
123            if self._can_bus:
124                message = self._can_bus.recv(timeout=timeout)
125                if message:
126                    return message.data
127            return None
128        except Exception as e:
129            self._logger.error(f"Error receiving CAN message: {e}")
130            return None
131
132    async def send_can_message(self, arbitration_id: int, data: bytes, is_extended: bool = False) -> bool:
133        """Send CAN message with specific arbitration ID."""
134        try:
135            if not self._can_bus:
136                raise Exception("CAN bus not initialized")
137
138            message = can.Message(
139                arbitration_id=arbitration_id,
140                data=data,
141                is_extended_id=is_extended
142            )
143
144            self._can_bus.send(message)
145            self._logger.debug(f"Sent CAN message ID=0x{arbitration_id:X}, data={data.hex()}")
146            return True
147
148        except Exception as e:
149            self._logger.error(f"Failed to send CAN message: {e}")
150            return False
151
152    def add_message_filter(self, arbitration_id: int, mask: int = 0x7FF) -> None:
153        """Add CAN message filter."""
154        self._message_filters.append({
155            'can_id': arbitration_id,
156            'can_mask': mask
157        })
158
159    def _can_message_handler(self, message: can.Message) -> None:
160        """Handle received CAN messages."""
161        try:
162            can_message = CANMessage(
163                timestamp=message.timestamp,
164                arbitration_id=message.arbitration_id,
165                data=message.data,
166                is_extended=message.is_extended_id,
167                is_remote=message.is_remote_frame,
168                channel=self._channel
169            )
170
171            # Call registered message handlers
172            for handler in self._message_handlers:
173                try:
174                    if asyncio.iscoroutinefunction(handler):
175                        asyncio.create_task(handler(can_message))
176                    else:
177                        handler(can_message)
178                except Exception as e:
179                    self._logger.error(f"Error in CAN message handler: {e}")
180
181        except Exception as e:
182            self._logger.error(f"Error processing CAN message: {e}")
